displayName: Ensure only the default permissions specified by Microsoft are granted to the public server role
rationale: Every SQL Server login belongs to the `public` role and cannot be removed from this role. Therefore, any permissions granted to this role will be available to all logins unless they have been explicitly denied to specific logins or user-defined server roles.
recommended_action:
1. Add the extraneous permissions found in the Audit query results to the specific logins to user-defined server roles which require the access. 
2. Revoke the _`<permission_name>`_ from the `public` role as shown below
 ```
 USE [master]
 GO
 REVOKE <permission_name> FROM public;
 GO
 ```
error_message: Public server role has extraneous permissions
ruleNames: Ensure only the default permissions specified by Microsoft are granted to the public server role
